results.title: Account Executive
results.description:
Web Scribble provides market-leading, innovative career center software to thousands of customers and hundreds of associations around the world. Associations depend on Web Scribble's job board software to provide clear member value, develop deep member insight and enhanced engagement, connect talented and qualified job seekers with the right employers, drive non-dues revenue, and advance shared missions. Web Scribble is currently in a high growth phase – growing 480% over the last three years – and was recently named to the Inc. 5000 list of the fastest-growing private companies in America.

As an Account Executive, you’ll fill a key role in acquiring new association customers and creating raving fans.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Have a true sales “hunter” mentality and conduct sales development best practices with email, phone, and social to connect with new prospects
  • Manage prospects from lead to close.
  • Provide an exceptional customer experience.
  • Clearly articulate and demonstrate our value proposition, creating excitement and enthusiasm among prospects.
  • Cultivate lasting relationships with customers.
  • Crush your quota.

Requirements

  • 0 - 3 years of relevant work/closing experience.
  • Previous SaaS and enterprise software experience.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Creative, resourceful, detail-oriented, and well-organized.
  • A strong team player but still a self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced, high-growth startup environment.

Benefits

  • We offer Scribblers a variety of medical, dental, and vision plans, designed to fit you and your family’s needs.
  • 401K program to help you invest in your future.
  • Paid time off to promote a healthy work-life blend.
  • Company-wide quarterly outings to recharge.
  • Competitive salary and uncapped commission structure.

 

Web Scribble is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that diversity is integral to our success, and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, age, or any other basis protected by law.

results.title: Senior QA Engineer (Manual)
results.description:
🤘Playson is a B2B game provider with 10 years of experience on the market. Since 2012 we have ambitiously developed worldwide recognition in the industry. Nowadays, our main focus is on regulated European Markets and we operate in 20+ different jurisdictions. As of 2022, we are continuously working on enhancing our portfolio, encompassing best practices in order to meet the highest standards of technology, design, support and interoperability.

We are looking for a passionate Senior QA Engineer to deliver high performance, fresh vision and desire for scalability within the company. Not only will you join a team of professional developers who work on new games, but become a part of our QA Community that strives for excellence and bright results.

 

Must-haves to succeed in the role: 

✅ At least 5+ years of experience in testing (front-end/back-end)

✅ Experience in client-server interaction testing

✅ Experience in mobile testing (different testing techniques run on mobile devices)

✅ Readiness to learn fast

✅ Communicability, experience in cross-team interaction

✅ Knowledge of agile development methodologies, SCRUM in particular

✅ Automation (any language and framework)

✅ Experience with GIT, CI (Jenkins) or equivalent

✅ Web-related knowledge (API, HTTP, Browser debugging)

✅ Cross browser testing (Chrome, Firefox, Safari)

✅ Usage of applications such as Postman

 

Would be beneficial to have experience in: 

➕ Experience in frontend performance testing (FPS, CPU and memory usage of mobile devices)

➕TestRail, Confluence

What will you be doing?
🤝 Managing the QA documentation
🤝 Implementing testing best practices and processes in the project
🤝 Critical production issues handling
🤝 Writing test cases/documenting errors
🤝 Functional, non-functional, regression and system testing
🤝 Performing manual testing (web, mobile)
🤝 Developing automation tests
🤝 Performance tests
🤝 Releasing of the new software version (game client/server)
🤝 Work closely with the development team to improve existing products
🤝 Participating in a scrum environment (stand-ups, planning sessions, etc.)

What you get in return:

🏆 Competitive salary fixed in USD with yearly performance reviews

🏆 Transparent bonus system on a quarterly basis

🏆 LLC via Diia City formalization

🏆 Full taxation coverage from the company’s side

🏆 Flexibility in your schedule

🏆 Remote Work

🏆 Full Medical Insurance for you and your +1

🏆 Special Life Event financial support

🏆 Unlimited paid vacation leave and Ukrainian bank holidays

🏆 Unlimited paid sick leave in case of necessity

🏆 Development courses/training reimbursement

🏆 Online English classes that do make a difference!

🏆 Employee Referral bonus program


The recruitment process includes the next steps:

1. HR Interview
2. Technical interview

3. Interview with CTO and Head Of Games



Does our career opportunity sound good to you - apply and let’s have a chat! We cannot wait to welcome you to the iGaming world!

 

Our mission:
Deliver entertainment and satisfaction to the lives of the busy world.

results.title: Senior Software Engineer
results.description:
Senior/Lead Software Engineer (Backend)
Summary:

Sortly has a reputation for simplicity and ease of use; we are seeking Software Engineers with a passion for building customer centric products with the right technology

Outcomes (what you will do):

  • Build awesome systems - Design, Write and Maintain high quality modular code
  • Do code reviews, participate in design & architecture discussions
  • Collaborate within the team for improving tooling and processes
  • Build product features via reliable, performant distributed backend platform and services
  • Participate in occasional on-call rotation of engineers to keep the site up
  • Mentor junior engineers in the team
Job Competencies / Requirements:
  • 3-10 years of experience in product companies writing high quality code
  • Strong knowledge of any coding language & ability to pick up new languages quickly
  • Demonstrated experience of owning and driving a feature/module lifecycle 
  • Demonstrated experience of designing complex systems and solving tough issues
  • Experience working in agile and iterative software development process
  • Ability to think analytically and approach the problems from first principles
  • Working knowledge of AWS and similar cloud technologies is highly desirable
Culture Competencies: 

 

  1. Remote first : Sortly is a remote-first company.  You should be comfortable working with team members in multiple geographies and time zones over virtual channels such as slack, gdocs and zoom calls and potentially travel periodically (say twice/thrice an year for in-person meetings.

This is a full-time, 100% remote position, open to applicants in India. Candidates must be

eligible to work in India.

results.title: Senior DevOps Engineer
results.description:
About Vay

At Vay, we pioneer change. We do work that has never been done before. We have a vision that we are excited to work for: To solve transportation in metropolitan areas.

We are developing an alternative approach to autonomous driving called teledriving. With our teledrive-first-approach we aim to offer a sustainable and safe service that can be an alternative to existing mobility services.

This is very ambitious. And we can’t do it alone. So we'd love to meet you!

Our team combines talent from multiple worlds: from automotive and safety engineering to software, product, regulatory, operations and many more. It is not only our technology that follows a human centred approach, but in everything we do, we keep the user's perspective and needs front of mind. This approach and the mix of talent creates a unique and stimulating work environment.

The role

As Senior DevOps Engineer you will be responsible for the CI/CD of the SW to our devices in the cars and telestations. Together with the team you will optimise the pipeline for stability, speed and costs. You collaborate with other teams, gathering requirements, enabling deployment and test automation on our test benches, and supporting CI/CD activities. Furthermore, you secure a seamless deployment to our production fleet.

The responsibilities:

  • Optimize our CI Pipeline to get faster, cheaper and more stable
  • Build infrastructure for running validation in the CI
  • Provide test automation infrastructure/framework for other components and validation team
  • Establish tools for monitoring, tracing, profiling and alerting
  • Extend CI/CD Pipeline
  • Automate Provisioning of Vehicles and Telestations
  • Implement state-of-the-art secret management
  • Manage SW and tools for running validations on our testbeds

The ideal profile:

  • 5+ years of experience in DevOps
  • Configuration management tools experience (e.g. CircleCI, Jenkins, Docker, Ansible, etc.)
  • Experience with managing, analyzing, and troubleshooting Docker containers
  • Competent skills using Linux OS and system administration
  • Familiarity with scripting like Python, Bash etc.
  • Experience in Software Development
  • Experience with networking, IT security
  • Involved in deployment and provisioning of (embedded) Linux devices
  • Experience with test automation of HIL (Hardware in the Loop)

Our values:

  • We pioneer change: At Vay, we’re doing work that has never been done before. This comes with challenges, frustrations and failures along the way. We embrace these challenges through perseverance and innovation, delivering creative solutions to overcome them.
  • We fuel collaboration: At Vay, we work as a team and strive for a common goal. We celebrate diversity and encourage different opinions. Our teams and partners communicate and collaborate openly. Together we build, improve, and grow.
  • We drive action: At Vay, everyone takes pride and commitment in their role for every task and every challenge. We are biassed towards action and get behind the steering wheel, even when there is none. We are empowered to take initiative and drive it to completion.
  • We build trust: At Vay, we consistently do the right thing, and follow through on our commitments to stakeholders, users and society. We understand their expectations and always respond in a way that feels human and respectful. We always put safety first and safety second.
  • We create magic: At Vay, we don’t just make things that work, we build products people love. We create unexpected and delightful moments for our riders. We design end-to-end experiences that leave a lasting expression.

Additional benefits:

  • You’ll be joining a highly committed, experienced, fun, and international team from over 30 countries. The team has previously worked at companies such as Tesla, Google, Waymo, Zoox, Byton, Argo, Amazon, Uber as well as Audi, BMW, and Daimler and has founded various companies before
  • You would be a part of solving transportation in metropolitan areas all over the world – from Europe
  • We organize thoughtful & fun team events throughout the year
  • We support highly flexible working policies
  • We provide healthy snacks, drinks, and coffee at our waterfront office in Berlin

We strongly encourage candidates of all different backgrounds and identities to apply. Each new hire is an opportunity for us to bring in a different perspective, and we are always eager to further diversify our company.

Vay is committed to building an inclusive, supportive place for you to do the best and most rewarding work of your career.

Come join the future!

results.title: Senior Data Engineer
results.description:
At SparkMeter our mission is to electrify everything and everyone. We help utilities and governments make the transition to electrification while providing affordable, reliable, clean power. We don’t care where in the world you are or how big or small you are. We are particularly interested in solving these problems in underserved markets that are served by outdated incumbents.

SparkMeter is searching for a Senior Data Engineer to lead the design and development of analytics and digital modeling solutions for the utility industry. As a Senior Data Engineer you will be responsible for developing data integrations and analytics capabilities within the SparkMeter platform and product. This role is a key member of our engineering team and will report directly to the VP of Engineering.

 

What you will be doing:

  • Design and implement data ingestion capabilities for system integration
  • Develop analytical data models
  • Develop data models for digital modeling of physical utility systems
  • Develop ETL code for populating data models
  • Devise end to end strategies for embedding analytics capabilities into SparkMeter products from ingestion through visualization
  • Deploy and integrate with data visualization solutions
  • Develop machine learning models for predictive analytics
  • Work closely with product managers to understand customer requirements

Requirements

Requirements & Skills:

  • Experience developing and supporting a commercial analytics product
  • Experience with coding in Python, R, Pig script, and SQL
  • Experience with performing data analysis, data ingestion and data integration
  • Experience developing ETL (Extraction, Transformation & Loading) and architecting data systems
  • Experience with schema design and data modeling
  • Experience in writing, analyzing, optimizing and debugging SQL queries
  • Basic understanding of various Big Data technologies
  • Solid communication and collaboration skills
  • Passionate and self-motivated about technologies in the Big Data area
  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or related fields or equivalent practical experience

Nice to have:

  • Utility industry experience
  • Demonstrated data science or quantitative analysis experience
  • Demonstrated experience handling terabyte size datasets, applying statistics and machine learning techniques and algorithms, and using visualization tools to present data.
  • Understanding of deep learning, or distributed computing (Hive/Hadoop).
  • Experience developing machine learning models or predictive analytics
  • Experience building data integration and analytics solutions using the AWS platform and services

Where you will work:

  • This is a 100% remote position, however we are headquartered in Washington D.C. and have an amazing downtown office that you are welcome to use. The team will also meet there periodically (likely quarterly), so some limited travel will be required.
  • You will report to the VP of Engineering who is in Denver, Colorado USA

Benefits

  • 401k with match
  • Annual bonus
  • Equity
  • Health insurance, with 100% of the premium covered for you, and 30% for your dependents
  • Paid vacation
  • 13 paid holidays

results.title: Product Safety and Compliance Specialist
results.description:
We’re TeeTurtle, a rapidly growing consumer products company that creates nerdy toys, games, apparel, and accessories. We are passionate about creating products that allow our fans to express themselves and share meaningful experiences.

 

We are looking for an experienced Product Safety and Compliance Specialist to ensure our products meet all domestic and international safety requirements.

 

Job Description:

  • Maintain files for current safety testing reports to ensure all testing remains in compliance with expected standards

  • Establish guidelines and create checklists with the Product Development team for product testing to ensure the correct safety testing is performed for each new item

  • Coordinate with the Product Development and Supply Chain teams to analyze test results and provide recommendations to ensure successful resolution

  • Coordinate with the Creative team to establish guidelines and create checklists of all current product packaging requirements to ensure compliance with all applicable guidelines

  • Coordinate with the Product Development team to proof data files for new products to ensure files are complete and accurate before the sampling process begins

  • Establish guidelines and create checklists of required safety testing documentation (PID, ISO 9001 certifications, etc.) for each of our wholesale partners to ensure accurate and smooth delivery of product

  • Coordinate with our factories and testing labs to clarify product testing, marking, and labeling requirements in order to ensure that all regulatory requirements are met

  • Work with our current testing facilities to negotiate pricing and explore alternative processes such as batch testing or raw material testing in order to improve and reduce unnecessary costs

  • Create SOPs for products and toy safety regulations to guide our team through the complex and often changing regulatory landscape of product testing requirements

  • Other duties as assigned

Core Competencies:

  • Process Orientation

  • Cross-Departmental Collaboration

  • Organization

  • Attention to Detail

  • Flexibility & Adaptability

  • Written Communication

  • Negotiation & Vendor Partnership

 

Qualifications:

  • High School diploma or equivalent (required)

  • 4+ years of safety and compliance experience (required)

  • 3+ years of experience working with toy parts or finished goods exports, compliance, and regulations (preferred)

  • Understanding of worldwide, local, state, and federal product safety standards (preferred)

  • Understanding of ASTM, ISO, and CEN standard development processes (required)

  • Proficiency in Google or Microsoft Office Suite (required)

  • Proficiency in Trello (preferred)

  • U.S. residency (required)

 

This is a full-time, exempt position that reports to the Supply Chain Manager.

 

 

Salary Range:

$40,000 - $60,000/yr. based on experience, qualifications, and skills

 

What We Offer:

  • Competitive salary and potential to receive an annual performance-based bonus;

  • Generous PTO policy to provide you flexibility and work-life balance;

  • 401(k) with a company match;

  • Defined contribution health plan that can cover the full cost of an employee-only medical plan, or be used toward other employee-only or family benefits such as medical, dental, vision, pet insurance, and so much more;

  • 75% employee discount on TeeTurtle.com and UnstableGames.com;

  • Optional education assistance;

  • A creative and fast-paced work environment;

  • A culture of integrity, compassion, and curiosity.

 
TeeTurtle provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, status as a covered veteran, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. TeeTurtle complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment, including hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

results.title: Senior Account Executive - Enterprise
results.description:
More time is spent on Insight Timer everyday than all other wellbeing and meditation apps. How? Combine 22+ million organic downloads, with the world's largest collection of wellbeing experts and content, plus industry leading app engagement that's 5x stronger than competing platforms.

In 2020 we added Workplace offerings to the platform. Today 65k companies have signed up, and that’s growing by 200 new companies every single day, including most of the Fortune 100, Fortune 1000 and beyond.

We’re now building a Sales team to bring our Premium solutions to the Enterprise. For the accelerating number of companies building Diversity, Equity & Inclusion into the very fabric of their organizations, Insight Timer’s Diversity-first Wellbeing platform is indispensable. Every employee can access world-class wellbeing teachers and content on Insight Timer, no matter their race, culture, sexual orientation, gender, ability, belief system, age or life experience. We’ve been piloting Premium Enterprise solutions with top companies and brands for a little while, and we are now ready to release case studies and testimonials to prove its impact.

About the Role

We are looking for a Senior Account Executive, with significant experience selling to companies with 5k employees or more. This is a great opportunity to get into a Sales team at its inception, with enormous opportunity for impact; on day 1 you’ll have 65k active leads to select from, each packed with data ready for you to have an insight-driven conversation with top executives at target accounts.

You should be passionate about both Wellbeing and Diversity & Inclusion, with a special skill for sparking that passion in others. You will engage in storytelling to help illustrate concepts and develop trust, be as comfortable in spreadsheets as you are in slides, have a strong business and SaaS acumen, and be able to connect dots top-down and bottom's up.

Given this is a foundational Sales team, we are looking for Sales professionals with strong entrepreneurial spirit. You’ll have a sense of urgency, mission, and be obsessively organized. This is a remote opportunity based in the US-West Coast.

Responsibilities

  • Drive revenue by inspiring senior executives at leading companies to urgently prioritize mental health and wellbeing, for all their people.
  • Successfully negotiate six and seven-figure contracts with C-suite, Senior HR, and Finance executives.
  • Create and execute on top-down & bottom-up account strategies, that enable both sales velocity and total revenue.
  • Be fluid with multi-motion Sales process, by prospecting new potential business independently, whilst leveraging all the benefits of Insight Timer’s PLG motion.
  • Navigate an enterprise to map stakeholders, build champions, generate buy-in and close deals with C-Level decision makers.
  • Serve as an expert to the customer to make informed recommendations about their business, benefits programs, diverse workforce and culture.
  • Instincts to recognize organizational, financial and behavioral structures and obstacles.
  • Impeccable customer skills: communication, compassion, and integrity, whilst finding ways to present Insight Timer’s unique value verbally, in writing, and quantitatively.
  • Coordinate with Insight Timer’s Customer Success team to ensure successful implementations that lead to great adoption and engagement.
  • Strategically manage up-sell / cross-sell opportunities.

About you

  • 8+ years of Sales success driving growth in a SaaS Sales team, with 4+ years of Account Executive experience selling to Enterprise.
  • Track record of over-achieving (top 10-20% of company).
  • Proven ability to prospect with Enterprise customers to maximize revenue growth.
  • Ability to land net new customers, whilst growing Net Dollar Retention by expanding existing customer usage and new product adoption.
  • Experience working with marketing, business, and product teams to find efficient paths to successful and profitable customers.
  • Holds self and others accountable for performance goals.
  • A drive to learn, succeed, and lead by example, adaptable to changing conditions, being comfortable with high levels of ambiguity, and possessing an entrepreneurial spirit.
  • Prior Sales methodology training.
  • Bonus: Experience during the scaling of a software or SaaS Sales organization.
  • Bonus: Previous success with selling into HR and Benefits teams is a plus.
  • Bonus: Salesforce/Hubspot and/or Outreach.io proficiency.

Benefits

You’ll be able to share in our success through a generous employee options plan, as well as an uncapped Sales compensation plan.

We have dedicated learning and development budgets to support your growth, as well as a competitive benefits plan.

We’re remote first, with no central office location. We dial in from all over the world, and it’s important that our team is just as diverse as our community of users, customers and teachers. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status.

Even if you don’t think you quite meet all of the skills listed or tick all the boxes, we’d still love to hear from you!

results.title: Senior Digital Marketing Manager
results.description:
Want to join one of Forbes’ next billion dollar startups that’s backed by VCs such as Kleiner Perkins, Accomplice, Gradient Ventures (Google’s AI Fund), BoxGroup, Village Global, and many more? If so, Secureframe could be the place for you. Secureframe is on a mission to help organizations build trust and stay secure. Getting secure can take months, slowing a company’s speed-to-market and sales. We believe security—when done right—should accelerate innovation and growth. That’s why we started Secureframe.
 
We’re looking for a Senior Digital Marketing Manager to manage our paid media strategy, results and all relevant KPIs. The right candidate for the role is an incredibly data-driven paid media expert with a proven track record driving a high volume of opportunities into sales. You will need deep expertise driving leads and pipeline from Google SEM, paid social, retargeting, and display ads. You will work closely with all other marketing groups, sales, product and ops to create campaigns, analyze data, and optimize all aspects of our paid media strategy.
 
This role is fully remote in the United States or Canada.



What you'll do
  • Drive qualified leads into our database and sales team through a paid digital playbook that is constantly optimized
